name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hood River Inn

reviews.text: Located right on the river, you can enjoy the freshest of salmon dishes while watching the anxiety-filled action outside. From the deck or inside, there's plenty to see from skidoos to windsurfers. Upwind a little and a brief walk away there are heart pounding antics aplenty with kites flying and boards jumping. Checkout the view from under the bridge, or take a trip across it to Washington. The west wing has the room you'll want, and book a room on the river. This is the perfect spot for visiting Multnomah Falls, the dam downstream, go hiking or just chill out in the pool. Add a massage for more aaahhhh. Breakfast is included and it's delicious. Get one boxed if you're out early.
reviews.title: Pick your passion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at this hotel, across the river from downtown. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was well equiped. Lovely swimming pool with loungers. The weight equipment in the Fitness Centre could do with updating and it would have been nice to have had some free weights as well.
reviews.title: Great Hotel on the River

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner and Breakfast were both very good.
reviews.title: Very pleasant by the river
Good views, but noisy in the west wing
reviews.text: Great location on the river. I found the check in staff to be courteous and helpful, in fact we were upgraded to a junior suite with a "spa bath" as the hotel was full and we had joined the best western rewards program. This was quite a spacious room and located at the eastern end of the complex near the bridge. The traffic noise was not a Hugh issue, but certainly noticeable. I wear earplugs anyway, so I had no problems. Ear plugs were supplied with the other bathroom amenities anyway. The spa bath, although there were jets present didn't seem to have a switch, but the bath was deep and welcome after a day exploring the gorge. Our room on the ground floor allowed easy access to the boardwalk, which made for a nice stroll after dinner.
We ate at the restaurant which was OK, but nothing to rave about, although the service was great and sitting in the deck by the river was nice.
reviews.title: Lovely, Updated Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not expect a Best Western to be this upscale. View of the river is amazing, the room was large, clean with a good decor Employees friendly and helpful. Pool are was modern with a great view of the river. The restaurant was also good. Could not have asked for anything more. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprise

reviews.text: My best friend and I were super excited to stay at this hotel since it was right along the river. Once we checked in immediately the young lady at the front desk was rude. She didn't speak much and just gave us our room keys and pointed to the left saying our room was "Down that way, past the handicap parking spots". We searched for our room and after 15 minutes finally found it. When we go up to the door the keys were already de-magnetized, and we were in the basement facing the parking lot. We went back to the front desk and waited in line.. noticed that the demeanor of the young lady at the front desk had completely changed for another guest, asked if he wanted a view room, and if he would like a property map outlining specifically where his room was. Then the next morning I woke up, looked at my sheets and there was a brown particle stuck to my sheets - it was gross.
reviews.title: Upset with Front Desk Customer Service

reviews.text: Enjoyed the location of the hotel, the waitstaff in the restaurant was excellent, but unhappy with the initial treatment when checking into the hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to land and stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms at the Inn are spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. The view of the Columbia and the walk along its banks are a wonderful asset. If you're like me, a light sleeper, bring ear plugs in case you stay in an east end room. The freeway traffic may keep you up for a while. But that's the cost of travelling.
reviews.title: What a spectacular view form this property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff at the facility are exceedingly accommodating, informative, and welcoming. I'd recommend the Inn with the lovely outdoor pool and hot tub, and the great restaurant (super food at decent prices) to everyone. I'll certainly be back.
reviews.title: Book One of the New East Wing Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved and received one of the riverview/balcony rooms in the new wing. It was great! Balcony and view were superb. We watched the windsurfer school and to the right we could see the action at the pool. Bed was comfy and curtains blocked most of the light. Bathroom, being new, was perfect. Glad to also have a small refrigerator to keep our leftovers. The breakfast choices which came with our room were varied and good quantity. We had a sunny breakfast on the deck at the restaurant, which was nice, as service was a bit slow.
reviews.title: Great place if you get new wing & river view
Not pet friendly, only dog friendly!
reviews.text: If you can get a room in the new wing and are willing to pay for the view side, you will not be disappointed. (We paid $152 with breakfast with a couple days notice.) If the whole facility was as nice as the new wing, we would have given the hotel five stars instead of four.

We were moving across country for the military and called ahead and reserved a pet room (we were moving with our cat. The lady who took our reservation and put us in a pet room. However, we got there, and were told that they only take dogs in their pet rooms. Stupid policy. So even though we had driven 6 hours that day and even called ahead and spoken directly to someone on the phone, we were being turned away. They did help us find another hotel. Luckily the columbia gorge hotel took pets and had rooms!
reviews.title: Older, dated property on the river.

reviews.text: As always, you seem to pay for the location and the views in Hood River are nice, if you can get a river view room. However, the rooms look like they have not been renovated since the mid-80s and the fireplaces don't work. The food at the restaurant is not that good; nor is the service. Yet it is very pricey. Again, you pay for the views. It is too bad that the owners have not spruced this place up. It could be so much more cozy. I doubt that I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Strange daylight basement room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall an average motel. We stayed on the ground floor so it was probably one of the least attractive rooms. Some rooms have views of the river which might be nicer than our room. For the cost I did not think the Best Western Hood River was an especially good deal. The breakfast was better than usual for a complimentary breakfast. The check-in staff seemed less helpful than most. This motel is okay, the rooms are clean, but I will probably try a different motel for my next stay to see if there is a better one or a better value.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night in Hood RIver, and I don't believe we could have found a nicer spot to spend our time. Our room was on the ground floor with a river view. It was spectacular. We relaxed on our room's patio and simply enjoyed the evening before going to bed.
reviews.title: Beautiful Riverfront Rooms!

reviews.text: Our room was very nice, very clean, and very quiet - everything we were looking for!
reviews.title: On par!

reviews.text: I am really picky when it comes to hotels, and I really can't complain of this place. After reading scores of reviews, I learned the most updated rooms were in the EAST WING and most people liked the ground floor rooms facing the water. I called the hotel a week or so ahead of time and requested these details. The hotel gave us a great river view room downstairs. Housekeeping was effiecient and cleaned our room every morning before 10am while we were at breakfast. The AC worked great and the bed was comfortable. We had a great stay!
reviews.title: Best Best Western Plus

reviews.text: My husband, myself and our pup took a road trip throughout the northwest and stayed at Best Westerns in the seven states we visited. First and foremost, they're all pet-friendly. I must rate the Best Western Plus Hood River Inn as being the "Best". From their well-appointed rooms to the comfortable beds, fantastic showers with excellent pressure - to their dining room - everything was top-notch!
reviews.title: Great view, good value, and newly renovated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of service, room, amenities, at this best western property. The check-in had a long line ( about 10 min wait) but worth it as we got a free room upgrade with a view of the river right from our hotel room. The room was well-appointed, new, and spacious. I honestly was very happy with the room. We also had couple extra requests (asking for wine bucket, table, which were addressed quickly and pleasantly). all in all, big thumbs up!
reviews.title: Nice Rooms, Right on the River

aka: Best Western Plus Hood River Hotel
description: Hood River's ONLY waterfront lodging and dining, on the breathtaking Columbia River with convenient access to all activities. Featuring rooms for every budget; from riverview rooms and suites to standard no-view rooms. Rooms feature mini-fridges, microwaves, hairdryers, irons & board, coffee makers, and high-speed wifi. Enjoy a delicious meal at the Riverside restaurant or Cebu Lounge. Take a dip in the new riverside pool and spa, or relax in the sauna. We pride ourselves on delivering excellence in customer service and high quality cleaning standards. Our friendly, helpful staff is ready to ensure a memorable stay.
